title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 17 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Chronicles chapter 17 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 17 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Chronicles Chapter 17.

questions.question: Who reigned in place of his father according to 2 Chronicles 17?
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshaphat
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:1 states, 'And Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead.'

questions.question: What did Jehoshaphat do in all the fenced cities of Judah?
questions.correctAnswer: Placed forces and set garrisons
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:2 says Jehoshaphat 'placed forces in all the fenced cities of Judah, and set garrisons in the land of Judah.'

questions.question: Why was the LORD with Jehoshaphat?
options: Because he walked in the first ways of his father David and sought not unto Baalim
Because he made war on Israel
Because he sought the gods of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Because he walked in the first ways of his father David and sought not unto Baalim
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:3 states the LORD was with Jehoshaphat because he followed David's ways and did not seek Baalim.

questions.question: What did Jehoshaphat remove from Judah according to 2 Chronicles 17?
questions.correctAnswer: High places and groves
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:6 states he took away the high places and groves out of Judah.

questions.question: In the third year of his reign, what did Jehoshaphat send his princes to do?
options: Teach in the cities of Judah
questions.correctAnswer: Teach in the cities of Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:7 says he sent princes to teach in the cities of Judah.

questions.question: Who were sent along with the princes to teach in Judah?
questions.correctAnswer: Levites and priests
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:8 mentions Levites and priests were sent with the princes to teach.

questions.question: What did the teachers carry with them as they taught throughout Judah?
options: The book of the law of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: The book of the law of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:9 states they had the book of the law of the LORD with them when teaching.

questions.question: What effect did the fear of the LORD have on the kingdoms around Judah?
options: They made no war against Jehoshaphat
questions.correctAnswer: They made no war against Jehoshaphat
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:10 tells that the fear of the LORD caused surrounding kingdoms to avoid war against Jehoshaphat.

questions.question: Who brought Jehoshaphat presents and tribute silver?
questions.correctAnswer: Some of the Philistines
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:11 states that some of the Philistines brought presents and tribute silver to Jehoshaphat.

questions.question: How many rams and he goats did the Arabians bring to Jehoshaphat?
options: Seven thousand and seven hundred each
questions.correctAnswer: Seven thousand and seven hundred each
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:11 says the Arabians brought 7,700 rams and 7,700 he goats.

questions.question: True or False: Jehoshaphat built castles and cities of store in Judah.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:12 confirms that Jehoshaphat built castles and cities of store in Judah.

questions.question: True or False: Jehoshaphat did not have mighty men of valour in Jerusalem.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:13 states that mighty men of valour were in Jerusalem under Jehoshaphat.

questions.question: True or False: Jehoshaphat's army included captains of thousands from the tribes of Judah and Benjamin.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 14-17 describe captains and mighty men of valour from Judah and Benjamin.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'And these are the numbers of them according to the house of their fathers: Of Judah, the captains of ______'.
questions.correctAnswer: thousands
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:14 begins with 'Of Judah, the captains of thousands.'

questions.question: Who was the chief captain of thousands of Judah with three hundred thousand mighty men of valour?
questions.correctAnswer: Adnah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:14 identifies Adnah as the chief captain with 300,000 mighty men of valour.

medium.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 17 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Chronicles Chapter 17 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with trusting God in their leadership role. Based on 2 Chronicles 17, what biblical truth would you share about faith and leadership?
options: Trust in God's presence and follow His commandments
Rely on your own wisdom and strength
Seek alliances with worldly powers for security
Ignore God's ways and focus on practical strategies
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in God's presence and follow His commandments
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat strengthened himself because the LORD was with him as he walked in the ways of David and sought God, not Baalim (verses 1, 3, 4). This teaches that faith and obedience to God are crucial for effective leadership.

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 17 teach about the importance of spiritual discipline in daily life?
options: By sending teachers and Levites to instruct the people in the law
By focusing only on military strength
By relying solely on material wealth
By isolating oneself from the community
questions.correctAnswer: By sending teachers and Levites to instruct the people in the law
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat sent princes and Levites to teach the law throughout Judah, emphasizing the importance of ongoing instruction and spiritual growth (verses 7-9).

questions.question: A believer is tempted to compromise their faith to gain favor. According to 2 Chronicles 17, what example does Jehoshaphat provide about obedience and integrity?
options: Jehoshaphat walked in God's commandments and did not follow Israel's idolatrous ways
Jehoshaphat sought Baalim to gain political advantage
Jehoshaphat ignored God's law to please the people
Jehoshaphat relied on alliances without seeking God
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshaphat walked in God's commandments and did not follow Israel's idolatrous ways
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat sought the LORD and walked in His commandments rather than following the idolatry of Israel, demonstrating faithfulness and integrity (verses 3, 4, 6).

questions.question: Based on 2 Chronicles 17, how does God respond to those who faithfully seek Him and walk in His ways?
options: God establishes their kingdom and grants them honor and peace
God allows constant battles and instability
God withdraws His favor and blessings
questions.correctAnswer: God establishes their kingdom and grants them honor and peace
questions.explanation: Because Jehoshaphat sought the LORD and walked in His ways, God established his kingdom, gave him riches, honor, and peace from surrounding kingdoms (verses 5, 10, 11).

questions.question: Jehoshaphat removed the high places and groves out of Judah. What does this action teach about humility and contentment?
options: It shows commitment to true worship and removing distractions
It teaches that religious traditions are unnecessary
It suggests pride in one's own reforms
It indicates neglect of cultural heritage
questions.correctAnswer: It shows commitment to true worship and removing distractions
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat's removal of high places and groves indicates humility before God and a desire for pure worship, avoiding idolatry and distractions (verse 6).

questions.question: A new believer asks how to grow in knowledge and understanding of God's Word based on 2 Chronicles 17. What practice would you recommend?
options: Regular teaching and study of the Book of the Law in community
Isolating oneself from others to read alone
Ignoring scripture and relying on feelings
questions.correctAnswer: Regular teaching and study of the Book of the Law in community
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat sent leaders with Levites and priests who taught the Book of the Law throughout Judah, highlighting communal study and teaching as a way to grow spiritually (verses 7-9).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 17, the fear of the LORD caused neighboring kingdoms to make war against Jehoshaphat.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The fear of the LORD fell upon surrounding kingdoms, so they did not make war against Jehoshaphat (verse 10).

questions.question: What does the tribute from Philistines and Arabians to Jehoshaphat teach about God's provision and stewardship?
options: God blesses faithful leaders with resources that should be managed wisely
Leaders should hoard wealth for themselves
Tribute is a sign of weakness and submission
questions.correctAnswer: God blesses faithful leaders with resources that should be managed wisely
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat received presents and tribute from surrounding peoples, suggesting God's blessing and the need for faithful stewardship (verse 11).

questions.question: How does Jehoshaphat's building of castles and cities of store relate to a Christian work ethic and preparation?
options: It demonstrates diligence, planning, and responsible management
It encourages reliance on others for security
It reflects neglect of spiritual matters
questions.correctAnswer: It demonstrates diligence, planning, and responsible management
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat's building projects indicate industriousness and prudent preparation, aligning with biblical principles of honest work and stewardship (verse 12).

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Chronicles 17, Jehoshaphat had mighty men of valor in Jerusalem and throughout Judah who supported him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The chapter lists many mighty men of valor in Jerusalem and throughout Judah who were ready to serve the king (verses 13-19).

questions.question: A believer is struggling with humility and gratitude. Based on Jehoshaphat's heart condition in 2 Chronicles 17, what biblical truth would you share?
options: A heart lifted up in the ways of the LORD leads to true honor and blessing
Self-reliance is better than dependence on God
questions.correctAnswer: A heart lifted up in the ways of the LORD leads to true honor and blessing
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat's heart was lifted up in the ways of the LORD, which resulted in removing idolatry and receiving blessings (verse 6). This teaches humility and devotion bring God's favor.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jehoshaphat sent Levites and priests to teach the people with the book of the ________.
questions.correctAnswer: law of the LORD
questions.explanation: The Levites and priests taught the people using the book of the law of the LORD, emphasizing God's Word (verse 9).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 17 illustrate the importance of godly counsel and teaching in church life?
options: Jehoshaphat appointed princes and Levites to teach scripture in the cities
Teaching was left only to the king
People were expected to learn on their own
questions.correctAnswer: Jehoshaphat appointed princes and Levites to teach scripture in the cities
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat sent leaders and Levites to teach the law in all the cities, showing the value of organized teaching and discipleship (verses 7-9).

questions.question: What does the military organization under Jehoshaphat teach about perseverance and readiness in spiritual battles?
options: Being prepared and having faithful warriors supports perseverance in trials
Relying only on peace without preparation is best
questions.correctAnswer: Being prepared and having faithful warriors supports perseverance in trials
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat had many mighty men of valor ready for battle, indicating the importance of being prepared and standing firm, which applies spiritually as perseverance (verses 13-19).

questions.question: How does Jehoshaphat's seeking God rather than Baalim teach us about dealing with temptation?
options: It shows the importance of rejecting false idols and staying faithful to God
It suggests that all religious paths are the same
It shows indifference to spiritual choices
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the importance of rejecting false idols and staying faithful to God
questions.explanation: Jehoshaphat sought the LORD and did not seek Baalim, teaching that resisting temptation and idolatry is essential for faithfulness (verses 3-4).

hard.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 17 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Chronicles Chapter 17.

questions.question: What was the primary reason the LORD was with Jehoshaphat according to 2 Chronicles 17?
options: Because he walked in the first ways of his father David
Because he married into a foreign kingdom
Because he defeated Israel in battle
questions.correctAnswer: Because he walked in the first ways of his father David
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:3 states that the LORD was with Jehoshaphat because he walked in the first ways of his father David and did not seek Baalim.

questions.question: Which cities did Jehoshaphat place forces and garrisons in, as mentioned in 2 Chronicles 17?
options: All the fenced cities of Judah and cities of Ephraim
questions.correctAnswer: All the fenced cities of Judah and cities of Ephraim
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:2 explains that Jehoshaphat placed forces in all the fenced cities of Judah and in the cities of Ephraim that Asa had taken.

questions.question: How did Jehoshaphat respond to the worship of Baalim?
options: He sought to the LORD God instead and did not seek Baalim
He worshipped Baalim alongside the LORD
He made Baalim the chief god of Judah
questions.correctAnswer: He sought to the LORD God instead and did not seek Baalim
questions.explanation: According to 2 Chronicles 17:3-4, Jehoshaphat sought the LORD God of his father and did not seek Baalim or follow the practices of Israel.

questions.question: What action did Jehoshaphat take that demonstrated his commitment to the LORD's ways?
options: He took away the high places and groves out of Judah
He built a great temple for Baalim
questions.correctAnswer: He took away the high places and groves out of Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:6 mentions that Jehoshaphat removed the high places and groves, which were often associated with idolatrous worship.

questions.question: Who were sent by Jehoshaphat to teach in the cities of Judah in the third year of his reign?
options: Princes and Levites, including Shemaiah and Nethaniah
questions.correctAnswer: Princes and Levites, including Shemaiah and Nethaniah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:7-8 states that Jehoshaphat sent princes and Levites such as Shemaiah, Nethaniah, and others to teach in Judah's cities.

questions.question: What book did the teachers carry with them as they went throughout Judah teaching the people?
options: The book of the law of the LORD
The book of the kings of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The book of the law of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:9 indicates that the teachers had the book of the law of the LORD with them as they taught in the cities of Judah.

questions.question: What effect did Jehoshaphat’s reign have on the surrounding kingdoms?
options: The fear of the LORD fell upon them, so they made no war against Judah
They formed an alliance to attack Judah
They ignored Judah and focused elsewhere
They increased tribute demands on Judah
questions.correctAnswer: The fear of the LORD fell upon them, so they made no war against Judah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:10 explains that the fear of the LORD caused neighboring kingdoms to refrain from waging war against Judah.

questions.question: Which groups brought Jehoshaphat presents and tribute during his reign?
questions.correctAnswer: Philistines and Arabians
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:11 notes that some Philistines and Arabians brought Jehoshaphat gifts and tribute.

questions.question: How many rams and he goats did the Arabians bring as tribute to Jehoshaphat?
options: Seven thousand seven hundred rams and seven thousand seven hundred he goats
Five thousand rams and six thousand he goats
Ten thousand rams and ten thousand he goats
questions.correctAnswer: Seven thousand seven hundred rams and seven thousand seven hundred he goats
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:11 specifies that the Arabians brought 7,700 rams and 7,700 he goats as tribute.

questions.question: What types of structures did Jehoshaphat build as he waxed great exceedingly?
questions.correctAnswer: Castles and cities of store
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:12 records that Jehoshaphat built castles and cities of store in Judah as he prospered.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The men of war in Jerusalem were described as mighty men of ______.
questions.correctAnswer: valour
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:13 describes the men of war as mighty men of valour.

questions.question: Who was the chief captain of thousands of Judah with 300,000 mighty men of valour under him?
questions.correctAnswer: Adnah
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:14 names Adnah as the chief captain with 300,000 mighty men of valour.

questions.question: True or False: Jehoshaphat sent only priests to teach the people in the cities of Judah.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:7-8 shows that Jehoshaphat sent both princes and Levites, as well as priests, to teach the people.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Jehoshaphat’s heart according to 2 Chronicles 17?
options: Lifted up in the ways of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Lifted up in the ways of the LORD
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:6 states that Jehoshaphat’s heart was lifted up in the ways of the LORD.

questions.question: What was the role of Jehozabad in the military ranking mentioned in this chapter?
options: Captain with 180,000 men ready for war
questions.correctAnswer: Captain with 180,000 men ready for war
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:18 records Jehozabad as a captain with 180,000 men prepared for war.

theological.title: 2 Chronicles Chapter 17 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Chronicles Chapter 17 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the primary reason the LORD was with Jehoshaphat according to 2 Chronicles 17?
options: Because he walked in the first ways of his father David and sought not Baalim
Because he made alliances with Israel
Because he built many castles and cities
Because he amassed a powerful army
questions.correctAnswer: Because he walked in the first ways of his father David and sought not Baalim
questions.explanation: 2 Chronicles 17:3 states that the LORD was with Jehoshaphat because he walked in the first ways of his father David and did not seek Baalim. This aligns with Deuteronomy 28:9, Psalm 78:70-72, 1 Kings 3:3, and Acts 13:22, illustrating God's blessing on obedience to His covenant.

questions.question: According to 2 Chronicles 17, what actions did Jehoshaphat take to strengthen Judah militarily?
options: Placed forces in all fenced cities and set garrisons in Judah and Ephraim
Made peace treaties with Israel and Philistines
Built a large navy to patrol the seas
Raised taxes to fund a standing army
questions.correctAnswer: Placed forces in all fenced cities and set garrisons in Judah and Ephraim
questions.explanation: Verse 2 states Jehoshaphat stationed forces in all the fortified cities of Judah and set garrisons in Judah and Ephraim. This reflects the biblical principle of preparedness (Nehemiah 4:13-14, Joshua 8:1-3, 2 Kings 20:5, Proverbs 21:31).

questions.question: What was the spiritual condition of Jehoshaphat's heart as described in 2 Chronicles 17?
options: Lifted up in the ways of the LORD and removed high places and groves
Idolatrous and influenced by Baalim worship
questions.correctAnswer: Lifted up in the ways of the LORD and removed high places and groves
questions.explanation: Verse 6 describes Jehoshaphat's heart as lifted up in God's ways, and he removed idol worship sites. This echoes Deuteronomy 12:2-3, 2 Kings 18:4, Psalm 119:2, and Romans 12:2 on wholehearted devotion to God and rejecting idolatry.

questions.question: Which strategy did Jehoshaphat employ to educate the people of Judah in the law of the LORD?
options: Sent princes and Levites with priests to teach in the cities
Built a central temple school for priests only
Relied on prophets to preach sporadically
Translated the law into common languages
questions.correctAnswer: Sent princes and Levites with priests to teach in the cities
questions.explanation: Verses 7-9 reveal Jehoshaphat dispatched princes, Levites, and priests throughout cities to teach the law. This method aligns with Deuteronomy 17:18-19, Ezra 7:10, Nehemiah 8:7-9, and Acts 5:42 emphasizing systematic and communal instruction in God's Word.

questions.question: What was the result of Jehoshaphat's faithful walk and teaching of God's law on the surrounding nations?
options: The fear of the LORD fell upon all surrounding kingdoms, preventing war
They formed an alliance to attack Judah
They ignored Judah and continued their own practices
They sent spies to sabotage Jehoshaphat's reign
questions.correctAnswer: The fear of the LORD fell upon all surrounding kingdoms, preventing war
questions.explanation: Verse 10 states that the fear of the LORD fell upon surrounding kingdoms, so they made no war against Jehoshaphat. This corresponds to Exodus 15:14, Joshua 2:9, Psalm 34:7, and Romans 13:1-4 highlighting God's sovereign protection over His people.

questions.question: What tribute did the Philistines and Arabians bring to Jehoshaphat as a sign of submission?
options: Philistines brought silver, Arabians brought 7,700 rams and 7,700 he goats
Philistines brought gold, Arabians brought spices
Philistines brought soldiers, Arabians brought horses
Philistines brought grain, Arabians brought camels
questions.correctAnswer: Philistines brought silver, Arabians brought 7,700 rams and 7,700 he goats
questions.explanation: Verse 11 records the Philistines brought silver and the Arabians brought flocks of rams and he goats. This tribute reflects biblical themes of submission and respect to God's appointed ruler (1 Samuel 10:27, 2 Kings 3:9, Isaiah 60:6, Matthew 2:11).

questions.question: How did Jehoshaphat's reign contribute to the infrastructure of Judah?
options: He built castles and cities of store
He destroyed old cities to centralize power
He focused only on spiritual reforms
questions.correctAnswer: He built castles and cities of store
questions.explanation: Verse 12 explains that Jehoshaphat built castles and storage cities, strengthening Judah physically and economically. This supports biblical principles of stewardship seen in Nehemiah 2:17-18, Proverbs 24:27, Isaiah 32:18, and Luke 14:28-30.

questions.question: What was the nature of the men who served in Jerusalem according to 2 Chronicles 17?
options: Mighty men of valor prepared for war
questions.correctAnswer: Mighty men of valor prepared for war
questions.explanation: Verse 13 notes that mighty men of valor were in Jerusalem, indicating a well-prepared and disciplined military presence. This aligns with biblical examples of godly warriors in Judges 6:12, 1 Samuel 17:34-37, 2 Samuel 23:8, and Ephesians 6:10-18 on spiritual and physical readiness.

questions.question: Who was the chief captain of thousands from Judah and how many mighty men of valor were under him?
options: Adnah, with 300,000 mighty men of valor
Jehohanan, with 280,000 mighty men of valor
Amasiah, with 200,000 mighty men of valor
Eliada, with 200,000 mighty men of valor
questions.correctAnswer: Adnah, with 300,000 mighty men of valor
questions.explanation: Verse 14 identifies Adnah as chief captain with 300,000 mighty men. This detailed military organization reflects biblical themes of leadership and preparedness (Numbers 1:3-4, 2 Samuel 23:8, Judges 7:3, 1 Corinthians 16:13).

questions.question: Which of the following captains willingly offered himself unto the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: Amasiah the son of Zichri
questions.explanation: Verse 16 states Amasiah willingly offered himself to the LORD, highlighting personal devotion in military leadership. This exemplifies Romans 12:1, Joshua 24:15, Psalm 110:3, and 2 Timothy 2:3 emphasizing consecrated service.

questions.question: Who was the mighty man of valor from Benjamin and how many armed men did he command?
options: Eliada, with 200,000 armed men with bow and shield
questions.correctAnswer: Eliada, with 200,000 armed men with bow and shield
questions.explanation: Verse 17 names Eliada as the mighty man of valor from Benjamin commanding 200,000 armed men. This parallels Judges 20:16, 1 Samuel 14:49, 2 Chronicles 14:8, and Psalm 144:1-2 regarding skilled warriors serving God's purposes.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jehoshaphat not seeking Baalim but the LORD God of his father in theological terms?
options: It signifies exclusive worship of the one true God and covenant faithfulness
It means he was indifferent to religious matters
It implies syncretism between Baalim and Yahweh worship
It shows political alliance with Baal worshippers
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies exclusive worship of the one true God and covenant faithfulness
questions.explanation: Verses 3-4 emphasize Jehoshaphat's rejection of Baalim worship and exclusive devotion to Yahweh, reflecting the Shema (Deuteronomy 6:4-5), covenant loyalty (Exodus 20:3), and monotheistic faith central to biblical theology (Isaiah 45:5, John 17:3).

questions.question: How does 2 Chronicles 17 illustrate the doctrine of God's providence in the life of Jehoshaphat?
options: God established Jehoshaphat's kingdom and caused enemies to make no war
Jehoshaphat's success was based solely on military might
Jehoshaphat's reign was uncontested due to human diplomacy alone
God abandoned Jehoshaphat to face continual warfare
questions.correctAnswer: God established Jehoshaphat's kingdom and caused enemies to make no war
questions.explanation: Verses 5 and 10 show God's providential hand in stabilizing Jehoshaphat's reign and deterring enemies. This aligns with Psalm 75:6-7, Proverbs 21:1, Romans 8:28, and Daniel 2:21 affirming God's sovereign governance over history.

questions.question: What role did the Levites and priests have in Jehoshaphat's reforms according to 2 Chronicles 17?
options: Teaching the law of the LORD throughout Judah
questions.correctAnswer: Teaching the law of the LORD throughout Judah
questions.explanation: Verses 8-9 indicate Levites and priests were sent to teach the law of the LORD in the cities. This is consistent with Numbers 8:14, Ezra 7:25, Nehemiah 8:7, and Acts 6:4 emphasizing their instructional and spiritual leadership role.

questions.question: What theological principle is demonstrated by Jehoshaphat's removal of high places and groves?
options: The rejection of idolatry to maintain covenant purity
The promotion of syncretistic worship practices
The establishment of Baal worship alongside Yahweh
The elevation of local shrines as equal to the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The rejection of idolatry to maintain covenant purity
questions.explanation: Verse 6 records Jehoshaphat removing high places and groves, symbolizing the rejection of idolatry and covenant unfaithfulness. This aligns with Exodus 34:14, Deuteronomy 12:29-31, 1 Kings 18:36-39, and 1 Corinthians 10:14 calling God's people to exclusive worship.
